parse.title: List of museums of Egyptian antiquities

text.*:
The following is a list of museums with major collections of Egyptian antiquities:

Museum collections of over 1,000 Ancient Egyptian artifacts[edit]

  1. Grand Egyptian Museum, Giza, Egypt: Over 100,000 artifacts[1] (due to be partially opened in 2018, currently housed in the Egyptian Museum, Cairo)
  2. British Museum, London, England: Over 100,000 artifacts[2] (not including the 2001 donation of the six million artifact Wendorf Collection of Egyptian and Sudanese Prehistory)[3][4]
  3. Ägyptisches Museum, Neues Museum, Berlin, Germany: About 80,000 artifacts[5]
  4. Petrie Museum of Egyptian Archaeology, London, England: About 80,000 artifacts[6]
  5. Musée du Louvre, Paris, France: 77.404 artifacts[7][8]
  6. Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, MA, USA: About 45,000 artifacts[9]
  7. Kelsey Museum of Archaeology, Ann Arbor, MI, USA: Over 45,000 artifacts[10]
  8. University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia, PA, USA: Over 42,000 artifacts[11]
  9. Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, England: About 40,000 artifacts[12]
  10. Museo Egizio, Turin, Italy: 32,500 artifacts[13]
  11. Oriental Institute, Chicago, IL, USA: About 30,000 artifacts[14]
  12. Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, NY, USA: About 26,000 artifacts[15]
  13. Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto, Canada: 25,000 artifacts[16]
  14. Hearst Museum of Anthropology, Berkeley, CA, USA: over 17,000 artifacts [17]
  15. Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge, England: Over 16,000 artifacts[18]
  16. World Museum, Liverpool, England: Over 16,000 artifacts[19]
  17. Manchester Museum, Manchester, England: About 16,000 artifacts[20]
  18. Egyptian Museum, Florence, Italy: Over 14,000 artifacts[21][22]
  19. Kunsthistorisches Museum, Vienna, Austria: Over 17,000 artifacts [23]
  20. Cinquantenaire Museum, Brussels, Belgium: Over 11,000 artifacts [24]
  21. Rijksmuseum van Oudheden, Leiden, The Netherlands: Over 9,000 artifacts[25]
  22. Pushkin Museum of Fine Arts, Moscow, Russia: More than 8,000 artifacts [26]
  23. Staatliche Sammlung für Ägyptische Kunst, Munich, Germany About 8,000 artifacts
  24. Roemer-und-Pelizaeus-Museum, Hildesheim, Germany: 8,000 artifacts[27]
  25. Ägyptisches Museum der Universität Leipzig, Leipzig, Saxony, Germany: About 8,000 artifacts[28]
  26. National Archaeological Museum, Athens, Greece: Over 6000 artifacts [29]
  27. National Museum of Scotland, Edinburgh, Scotland: 6,000 artifacts[30]
  28. The Hermitage, St Petersburg, Russia: Over 5,500 artifacts [31]
  29. Peabody Museum of Natural History, New Haven, CT, USA: Over 5,000 artifacts[32]
  30. The Egypt Centre, Swansea University, Swansea, UK: Over 5000 artifacts[33]
  31. Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum, Glasgow, Scotland: 5,000 artifacts[34]
  32. Museum of Fine Arts, Budapest, Hungary: Over 4,000 artifacts[35]
  33. Rosicrucian Egyptian Museum, San Jose, CA, USA: Over 4,000 artifacts[36]
  34. Field Museum, Chicago, IL, USA: Over 3,500 artifacts[37]
  35. Museo Civico Archeologico, Bologna, Italy: About 3,500 artifacts[38]
  36. Brooklyn Museum, Brooklyn, NY, USA: More than 3,000 artifacts[39]
  37. National Museum of Ireland, Dublin, Ireland: About 3,000 artifacts[40]
  38. Carnegie Museum of Natural History, Pittsburgh, PA, USA: More than 2,500 artifacts[41]
  39. Naples National Archaeological Museum, Naples, Italy: 2,500 artifacts[42]
  40. Hunterian Museum and Art Gallery, Glasgow, Scotland: 2,300 artifacts[43]
  41. Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek, Copenhagen, Denmark: More than 1,900 artifacts[44]
  42. National Museum of Natural History, Washington, DC, USA: More than 1,900 artifacts[45]
  43. Los Angeles County Museum of Art, Los Angeles, CA, USA: More than 1,600 artifacts[46]
  44. Musée des Beaux-Arts de Lyon, Lyon, France: 1,500 artifacts[47]
  45. Art Museum of the University of Memphis, Memphis, TN, USA: more than 1,400 artifacts[48]
  46. Cleveland Museum of Art, Cleveland, OH, USA: more than 1000 artifacts[49]
  47. Freer Gallery of Art, Washington, DC, USA: More than 1000 artifacts[50]

Other significant collections with unspecified number of artifacts[edit]

  • Alexandria National Museum, Alexandria, Egypt
  • Allard Pierson Museum, Amsterdam, Netherlands
  • Antikenmuseum Basel und Sammlung Ludwig, Basel, Switzerland
  • Bible Lands Museum, Jerusalem, Israel
  • Chrysler Museum of Art, Norfolk, VA, USA
  • Egyptian Museum, Milan, Italy
  • Fleming Museum, Burlington, VT, USA
  • Calouste Gulbenkian Museum, Lisbon, Portugal
  • Indian Museum, Kolkata, India
  • Israel Museum, Jerusalem, Israel
  • Imhotep Museum, Saqqara, Egypt
  • Museum August Kestner, Hanover, Germany
  • Luxor Museum, Luxor, Egypt
  • Michael C. Carlos Museum, Atlanta, GA, USA
  • Musée d'Art et d'Histoire, Geneva, Switzerland
  • Musée royal de Mariemont, Morlanwelz, Belgium
  • National Archaeology Museum, Lisbon, Portugal
  • National Museum of Egyptian Civilization, Cairo, Egypt
  • Newark Museum, Newark, NJ, USA [51]
  • Museo Gregoriano Egiziano, Vatican City
  • Museum of Ancient Orient, Istanbul, Turkey
  • Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art, Kansas City, MO, USA
  • Robert and Frances Fullerton Museum of Art (RAFFMA), California State University, San Bernardino, CA, USA
  • San Antonio Museum of Art, San Antonio, TX, USA
  • San Diego Museum of Man, San Diego, CA, USA
  • Semitic Museum, Cambridge, MA, USA
  • Sir John Soane's Museum, London, England
  • Toledo Museum of Art, Toledo, OH, USA
